Republicans Finally Get â€˜Vengeanceâ€™ Against Ilhan Omar, Eric Swalwell and Adam Schiff
collin January 11, 2023 SHARE

Three House Democrats, in particular, have been among the biggest nuisances to the Republican Party for years.

Rep. Ilhan Omar (MN), Rep. Eric Swalwell (CA), and Rep. Adam Schiff (CA) have constantly poked their fingers in the eyes of Republicans every chance they have gotten.

McCarthy told Punchbowl News in an interview published Tuesday that he will prevent Schiff and Swalwell from sitting on the House Intelligence Committee and will boot Omar from the House Foreign Affairs Committee.

â€œSwalwell canâ€™t get a security clearance in the private sector. Iâ€™m not going to give him a government security clearance,â€ McCarthy said. â€œSchiff has lied too many times to the American public. He should not be on Intel.â€

On Monday, McCarthy had also remarked on the forthcoming ban to Associated Press reporters.

â€œItâ€™s not like itâ€™s anything new,â€ McCarthy added. â€œRemember, this is what Nancy Pelosi â€“ this is the type of Congress she wanted to have.â€

In an interview with Breitbart News a year ago, McCarthy laid out his plans to block them from coming back onto their influential committees.

â€œThe Democrats have created a new thing where theyâ€™re picking and choosing who can be on committees,â€ McCarthy said. â€œNever in the history [of Congress] have you had the majority tell the minority who can be on committee. But this new standard which these Democrats have voted forâ€”if Eric Swalwell cannot get a security clearance in the private sector, there is no reason why he should be given one to be on Intel or Homeland Security. He will not be serving there.â€

â€œIlhan Omar should not be serving on Foreign Affairs,â€ McCarthy also said. â€œThis is a new level of what the Democrats have done.â€

In addition, McCarthy said he would also prevent Adam Schiff (D-CA) from serving on the Intelligence Committee.

â€œYou look at Adam Schiffâ€”he should not be serving on Intel when he has openly, knowingly now used a fake dossier, lied to the American public in the process and doesnâ€™t have any ill will [and] says he wants to continue to do it,â€ McCarthy said. â€œWeâ€™re going to reshapeâ€”think about what happened in Afghanistan. Why did Afghanistan collapse so fast? Was the Intel Committee under Adam Schiff focused on impeachment and not on the safety of America? Why are people coming across the border that are on a terrorist watch list? What are they doing about it? Their own members on that committee say itâ€™s not happening when itâ€™s true. We need to have an Intel Committee that looks at whatâ€™s happening around the world and keeps America safe. It should do exactly what it was created [to do]â€”overseeing of our agencies and others. Weâ€™re going to hold people to a higher standard in the process if they want to be on the Intel Committee and the training to be a part of it. Take the politics out of it.â€

In 2021, then Speaker Pelosi and the Democrat majority stripped Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene (R-GA) and removed Rep. Paul Gosar (R-AZ) from their committee assignments.

Eric Swalwell reacted on Twitter by claiming that McCarthyâ€™s maneuver was no more than the GOP getting â€œvengeanceâ€ against them.

Attorney Jenna Ellis provided the full transcript showing that Donalds had made no such remark.

Conservatives were quick to point out what Swalwellâ€™s removal was really all about.

â€œYouâ€™re the guy that had an affair with a Chinese spy, right?â€ lawyer and commentator Viva Frei replied. â€œYep, no reason whatsoever.â€

â€œFang Fang says â€˜cry harder, Ericâ€™,â€ BlazeMediaâ€™s Sara Gonzalez quipped.

â€œActually itâ€™s because you banged a Chinese spy,â€ Dave Rubin noted.

As for Ilhan Omar, the Squad member has made numerous incendiary remarks about Republicans. Adam Schiff, of course, was a key player in the Russia Hoax and the two impeachment hoaxes. America is still waiting for his â€œdirect evidenceâ€ of Trump-Russia collusion.

As for Kevin McCarthy, it looks thus far like he is going to fight fire with fire. Letâ€™s hope that this act of â€œvengeanceâ€ is the first of many. After all, turnabout is fair play.

Follow Kyle Becker on Twitter @kylenabecker.

card.html: <iframe width="200" height="113" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/4kyqEFwrZNo?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="" title="Jeff Beck - A Man For All Seasons: In the '60s (docu 2015)"></iframe>
card.title: Jeff Beck - A Man For All Seasons: In the '60s (docu 2015)

_source.content: A 2015 documentary on Jeff Beck: A the end of 1964, celebrated guitar maestro Eric Clapton left the Yardbirds, a band still searching for their first hit. His replacement was a player of very different capabilities - a technical and sonic pioneer who helped propel the group from their former status as a blues covers act, to become one of the most innovative and daring musical collectives working in the UK. This film traces Jeff Beck's music and career throughout the 1960s - his formative influences and early groups, his work with The Yardbirds, his brief, bizarre reinvention by producer Mickie Most as a solo pop star, and the first, radical incarnation of the Jeff Beck Group, during which he played alongside vocalist Rod Stewart and then bass player Ron Wood.Featuring a plethora of rare performance and studio footage, exclusive interviews, contributions from those who worked with and alongside Jeff during this period and a host of other features, all of which combine to make this documentary - the first yet to singularly focus on Beck's career - a legitimate tribute and enthralling history of this often underrated musician, writer and performer. A the end of 1964, celebrated guitar maestro Eric Clapton left the Yardbirds, a band still searching for their first hit. His replacement was a player of very different capabilities - a technical and sonic pioneer who helped propel the group from their former status as a blues covers act, to become one of the most innovative and daring musical collectives working in the UK.

Featuring a plethora of rare performance and studio footage, exclusive interviews, contributions from those who worked with and alongside Jeff during this period and a host of other features, all of which combine to make this documentary - the first yet to singularly focus on Beck's career - a legitimate tribute and enthralling history of this often underrated musician, writer and performer.

Includes new interviews with: Yardbirds first manager, Giorgio Gomelsky; the man who took over from Gomelsky, colourful music biz impresario, Simon Napier Bell; Jeff's fellow Yardbirds, Jim McCarty & Chris Dreja; musical conspirators from the early 70s, Tim Bogert & Max Middleton; the ever shocking Pamela Des Barres (aka Miss Pamela of The GTOs); legendary music press scribes, Charles Shaar Murray & Chris Welch; Beck's official biographer Martin Power and Uncut Magazine editor, Nigel Williamson.

The band is principally known for starting the careers of three of rock's most famous guitarists, Eric Clapton, Jimmy Page and Jeff Beck, all of whom are ranked in the top five of Rolling Stone magazine's list of 100 greatest guitarists.

The Yardbirds are an English rock band, formed in London in 1963. The band's core lineup featured vocalist and harmonica player Keith Relf, drummer Jim McCarty, rhythm guitarist and later bassist Chris Dreja and bassist/producer Paul Samwell-Smith.

The band had a string of hits throughout the mid-1960s, including "For Your Love", "Heart Full of Soul", "Shapes of Things" and "Over Under Sideways Down".

Originally a blues-based band noted for their signature "rave-up" instrumental breaks, the Yardbirds broadened their range into pop, pioneering psychedelic rock and early hard rock; and contributed to many electric guitar innovations of the mid-1960s. Some rock critics and historians also cite their influence on the later punk rock, progressive rock and heavy metal trends.

Following the band's split in 1968, Relf and McCarty formed Renaissance and guitarist Jimmy Page formed Led Zeppelin - the latter of which was initially intended as a direct successor to the Yardbirds.

The band was inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1992. They were included at number 89 in Rolling Stone's list of the "100 Greatest Artists of All Time" and ranked number 37 on VH1's 100 Greatest Artists of Hard Rock.

The Yardbirds re-formed in the 1990s, featuring drummer Jim McCarty and rhythm guitarist Chris Dreja as the only original members. Dreja left the band in 2012, leaving McCarty as the sole original member of the band in the present lineup.

#IllegalAliens #Border
Hereâ€™s a taste of what Bidenâ€™s open-border policies cost local taxpayers across America
nypost ^ | 1/11/2023 | EDITORIAL BOARD
https://nypost.com/2023/01/11/heres-a-taste-of-what-bidens-open-border-policies-cost-local-taxpayers-across-america/

How much are President Joe Bidenâ€™s open-border policies costing taxpayers? What sort of impact is the addition of millions of people who canâ€™t legally work, mostly donâ€™t pay taxes and need food, shelter and education having on our communities?

Democrats are trying to hide the answers to these questions, to keep secret the true price of Bidenâ€™s ineptitude.

Consider just one cost. Mayor Eric Adams has set up four â€œemergency sheltersâ€ in New York City hotels â€” the Stewart, the Row, the Wolcott and the Watson. Whistleblower Row employee Felipe Rodriguez revealed to The Post that the city is spending $400-$500 a night on rooms there.

The mayor wonâ€™t reveal the confirmed cost to us, but some rough estimates reveal the ballpark pricetag.

These hotels have 2,745 rooms. As The Post reported last week, all four are turning away migrants, saying every room is full.

So thatâ€™s costing New York City an estimated $1 million-$1.37 million a day. Thatâ€™s $365 million-$500 million a year.

We only know this much because of Rodriguezâ€™s bravery. We donâ€™t know the cost of food, or for schools or for social services.

While not revealing specifics, Adams has requested $1 billion from the feds. Theyâ€™ve given him a whopping $8 million.

So the Biden strategy is: Every city and state for themselves. As The Post has reported, the administration is flying illegal immigrants into random small airports and leaving shocked local communities to handle them. They leave it to El Paso to bus people to Chicago, while Colorado gets them a ticket to New York.
